action.action-desc: Mr. Francis Rooney of Florida (for himself, Mr. Norman, and Mr. Allen) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require students who do not complete a program of study to repay Federal Pell Grants.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Pell for Performance Act.

section.header: Repayment for failure to complete program
section.text: Section 401 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070a) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by striking The period and inserting Except as provided in subsection (k), the period; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Repayment for failure To complete program

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraph (3), if a recipient of a Federal Pell Grant fails to complete the program for which the Federal Pell Grant was awarded within the maximum timeframe for completion of such program, the sum of the amounts of any Federal Pell Grants received by the recipient for the program shall—

subparagraph.text: be treated as a Federal Direct Unsubsidized Stafford Loan under part D; and
be subject to repayment, together with interest thereon accruing from the date of the grant award, in accordance with terms and conditions specified by the Secretary.

paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the term maximum timeframe, used with respect to the completion of an undergraduate program, has the meaning given such term in paragraph (1) or (2) of section 668.34(b) of title 34, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of enactment of this Act), as applicable to such program.

subparagraph.text: Paragraph (1) shall not apply with respect to a student who fails to complete a program within the maximum timeframe for completion of such program—

clause.text: because the student enrolls in another program at an institution of higher education—

subclause.text: not later than 12 months after the date of the student’s last day of the previous program; and
for which the previous program provided substantial preparation;

clause.text: in the case of a student who has a Federal Pell Grant that is being treated as a loan under paragraph (1) and who meets the requirements of subparagraph (B) of this paragraph, with respect to a subsequent Federal Pell Grant for which the student is eligible and which is awarded beyond such maximum timeframe; or

subclause.text: the death of a relative of the student;
the personal injury or illness of the student; or
other special circumstances as determined by the institution.

subparagraph.text: In order to qualify for the exception under subparagraph (A)(ii) of this paragraph, a student shall—

clause.text: have a Federal Pell Grant that is being treated as a loan under paragraph (1) for which the student has met the loan repayment obligations for not less than 6 months; and
not be an individual described in paragraph (4)(B).

paragraph.header: Loss of Federal Pell Grant eligibility

subparagraph.text: An individual who is in default of an obligation to repay a Federal Pell Grant that is being treated as a loan under paragraph (1) shall be ineligible to receive a Federal Pell Grant under this section.

An individual who has received a Federal Pell Grant for enrollment in a program that is being treated as a loan under paragraph (1), and who leaves such program for a second time (other than for a reason described in clause (i) or (iii) of paragraph (3)(A)), shall be ineligible to receive a Federal Pell Grant under this section.

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall ensure that each recipient of a Federal Pell Grant receives notice of the terms of this subsection.

An institution shall keep a record that tracks the progress (including the graduation and default rate) of any student described in paragraph (3)(B) who receives a Federal Pell Grant for enrollment in a program beyond the maximum timeframe for completion of such program.
